programmes.show_description: Could do better. Stars Adam Faith, Iain Cuthbertson, Lynn Dalby. Budgie's new job in Charles' bookshop is proving profitable. A problem for Hazel leads him back to his old school and into trouble.
1964. Horror. Directed by Ubaldo Ragona & Sidney Salkow. Stars Vincent Price & Franca Bettoia. When a disease turns all humans into vampiric zombies, the last man on earth must fight to survive.
1984. Drama. Director: David Rowan. Stars Guy Rolfe, Raymond Francis & Juliet Hammond. Sherlock Holmes and Doctor Watson exit retirement to solve a case concerning the artist, Marcel Duchamp.

programmes.show_name: Look At Life In the Honours List
programmes.show_description: 1969. An extraordinary look at the peerages, knighthoods and memberships of the various grades of the Orders of Chivalry rewarded to men and women who have deserved well of their country.
Made in 1971, a look at the design and production of various products that were big household names in the 70s!
1959. The Long Rider. Western with Peter Breck. After his brothers are killed in a shootout, a gunfighter decides to hang up his guns and uphold the law by becoming a lawyer.
1946. Adventure. Director: Irving Allen. Stars Eddie Albert & Forrest Taylor. An adventurer rents a sailing ship to hunt for a treasure and winds up battling bad weather, rough seas and the crew.
1949. Western. Directed by Geroge B. Seitz Jr. Stars Clayton Moore & Jay Silverheels. The sole surviving Texas Ranger of a murderous ambush becomes the great masked hero who fights for justice.
1952. Comedy. Henry is a mild man who writes adventure stories for his girls. All is fine until he meets Miss Honey! Starring Richard Hearne & Margaret Rutherford. Directed by John Guillermin.
1980. Thriller. A man just released from prison for manslaughter heads to the West Country to solve the mystery behind his victim's cryptic last words. Stars Ian McShane, Wendy Morgan & John Bird.
1939. Detective Drama. Directed by Fred Elles. Starring Mary Clare, Edward Lexy & Nigel Patrick. A woman detective sets about solving the murder of people who have all frequented the same medium.
1955. Crime directed by Terence Fisher. A racing driver (John Bentley) plans to murder his heiress wife (Rona Anderson). The lawyer (Donald Houston) discovers the plot.
The Woman Least Likely - Part 1. 1974. Stars David Ashford, William Mervyn & William Simons. Irene Rutland is in court facing charges of theft, criminal damage and wounding a police officer.
The Woman Least Likely - Part 2. 1974. Stars Katharine Blake, David Troughton & Sara Clee. Linda Brightson accuses the defendant of taking her handbag but Mrs Rutland denies the charge.
The Woman Least Likely - Part 3. 1974. Stars Griffith Jones, William Marlowe & David Ashford. Bryan Hodge admits that after the death of Irene's husband, she began to drink alcohol after work.
1959. War. Director: Alvin Rakoff. Stars Eddie Constantine, Dawn Addams, Marius Goring, Christopher Lee. Ex-serviceman, Larry, returns to Europe to retrieve jewels hidden from the Nazis in 1944.

programmes.show_name: Who Were You With Last Night
programmes.show_description: Glimpses. 1963. 'Who Were You With Last Night' with the Paramount Jazz Quartet.
Bonnybridge/Painless Penny. 1994. Michael Aspel delves into supernatural stories, including reports of UFO sightings in a Scottish town and a young girl who predicted the death of her grandma.
A Worm in the Bud. 1972. Richard Easton, Hamilton Dyce & Johnny Briggs. Hammond Transport is threatened with a take-over bid. Meanwhile, Ann makes a decision about her relationship.
Man on a Cliff. 1957. Stars Donald Gray, Diana Decker & Catherine Finn. Mark Saber investigates the suspicious death of a stockbroker who jumped from a cliff.

programmes.show_name: The Wheeltappers and Shunters Social Club
programmes.show_description: Episode 25. 1975. Julie Rogers performs 'My World Gets Smaller Every Day', and Wild Honey perform 'I Can't Leave You Alone'. Plus, Dustin Gee, Ronnie Dukes and Ricki Lee star.
1972. Comedy. Director: Jim Clark. Stars James Booth, Richard Briers & Julie Ege. The incompetent detectives of Rentadick Inc track thieves of a nerve gas that paralyses from the waist down.
1972. With Freddie Starr and Peter Goodwright, guest acts such as Little & Large, Roger Kitter and Dailey & Wayne play a number of roles in a series of sketches and songs!
1952. Drama. Directed by Terence Fisher. Stars Paul Henreid & Lizabeth Scott. A doctor makes a female convict look like the pianist who left him, but can she really be the woman he loves?
The Flight of the Lapwing - Part 1. 1974. Stars Richard Wilson, Ian Marter & John Barron. The pilot and only survivor of a light aircraft crash is suing a relative of one of the victims for libel.
The Flight of the Lapwing - Part 2. 1974. Stars William Gaunt, Mary MacLeod & Christopher Benjamin. The cause of the crash was carbon monoxide, but nothing was found in the tissue of the dead.
The Flight of the Lapwing - Part 3. 1974. Stars John Barron, Mary Macleod & William Gaunt. Mrs Simon claims she knew the pilot was prone to epileptic fits. She calls him a liar and a killer.
1947. Western. Connie Dickson (Veronica Lake) plans to marry a sheep rancher, but her father teams up with land baron Frank Ivey to drive the man out of town.

programmes.show_name: The World of Budgerigars with Sid James
programmes.show_description: 1976. Stars Sid James, Patricia Burke and Philip Marsden. Sid learns of the joys of owning a Budgerigar in this very rare, 'lost' short film, possibly the last footage of Sid.
1963. Who Killed Wade Walker? Directed by Stanley Z Cherry. Stars Gene Barry, Gary Conway & Regis Toomey. Wealthy Wade Walker is killed when his plane blows up in mid-air.
1960. Dangerous Barriers. Stars Michael Ansara, Steven Marlo & Arch Johnson. Sam investigates when a rancher murders a local teenage boy's father in order to get his land.
1961. Romance. Director: Francis Searle. Stars: Emrys Jones, Patricia Dainton & Denis Shaw. The film tells the story of romance between a travel agent and a tourist on holiday in Italy.
Embarrassing Stories. 1976. Personal anecdotes as told to Dick Hills. This episode stars Roger de Courcey, Percy Edwards, Dickie Henderson, Vince Hill, Miriam Karlin & Sylvia Syms.
1957. Crime drama directed by Henry Cass. An American detective & Scotland Yard must work together to crack a counterfeit gang. Stars Wayne Morris, Karin Booth and Anton Diffring.
1954. Drama. Directed by John Arnold. Stars Diane Cilento, Lee Patterson & Duncan Lamont. Diane Cilento runs a caf√© in a small English town and is swept off her feet by a mysterious stranger.
1965. Drama. Director: Lance Comfort. Stars William Sylvester, Barbara Shelley & Elizabeth Shepherd. The wife of a blind composer plots to murder her husband after he learns of her affair.
Sinister Man. 1961. Directed by Clive Donner. Stars John Bentley, Patrick Allen & John Glyn-Jones. Superintendent Wills investigates the theft of some mysterious oriental tablets.
1960. Drama. Directed by David Eady. Starring John Gregson, Mai Zetterling & John Ireland. Richard, a factory owner, becomes blind during an experiment on the very day his wife wants a divorce.
1956. War drama. Directed by Lewis Gilbert and stars Kenneth More, Muriel Pavlow and Lyndon Brook. This is the true story of Douglas Bader, who loses his legs but returns to flight during WW2.
1943. Drama. Director: Maurice Elvey. Stars Rosamund John, Stewart Granger, Godfrey Tearle. Architect Hilary Clark decides to become a nurse. Follow her battle between her heart and her vocation.
1969. An insight into the life of Britain's top models, with a look at the rewards of the job.
Appearance in Court. 1962. Stars Joseph Brady, Brian Blessed & Dudley Foster. Catching a thief is only the beginning. Smith and Weir go to court and the truth is not looking whole...
Caroline Munro opens the Cellar Club by introducing the third episode of Supernatural, ''The Werewolf Reunion''.
The Werewolf Reunion. 1977. Stars Billie Whitelaw, Ian Hendry & Charles Kay. The surviving admirers of the Countess Ilona realise there is no escape from her isolated castle and night is falling.
Up next at the Cellar Club, Caroline Munro introduces ''The Terror''. This 1963 supernatural horror film stars Boris Karloff and Jack Nicholson.
1963. Horror. Director: Roger Corman. Stars Boris Karloff, Jack Nicholson, Sandra Knight & Dick Miller. A soldier loses contact with his unit and is forced to wander alone near the Baltic Sea.
Before wrapping up tonight's Cellar Club, Caroline Munro covers what to expect next week at the Cellar Club!

programmes.show_name: Hammer House of Mystery and Suspense
programmes.show_description: Black Carrion. 1984. Stars Season Hubley, Leigh Lawson & Norman Bird. Two journalists are hired to track down a famous pop duo from the sixties who unexpectedly disappeared.
